body:
kube-proxy regularly stops running with the below panic / stack-trace.  This is when configured with vagrant.  (It is also running on a laptop, so my unsupported-by-any-evidence theory is that it happens when the laptop resumes after sleep.)

Restarting the service causes the proxy to continue working happily.  (Should systemd be restarting the service?)

Aug 13 12:04:06 kubernetes-minion-1 kube-proxy[31108]: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

title: kube-proxy stops running (panic in pkg/proxy/config/etcd.go)
